IPR - II

Syllabus IPR-II.pdf

UNIT I - Indian Copyright Law

Essay Type

  1. Explain the works in which copyright subsists and in which copyright does not subsist . 6x
  1. What is infringement of copyright ? What acts do not amount to infringement of copyright ? 2x
  1. What constitutes infringement ? What are the remedies available for infringement ? Explain. 3x
  1. Explain the modes of Assignment of copy right under Copy Right Law. 2x
  1. Describe the various modes of transfer of copyright. 2x
  1. Describe the various rights of owner of Copyright. 2x
  1. 'lntellectual property rights protect the novelty in the products of human intellect in whatever field of human activity and endeavour'. Elucidate.
  1. "Copy right exists in expression of idea and not in idea it self" Elucidate.
  1. What is copyright ? Explain the salient features of Copyright Act .
  1. Write briefly the origin and development of copyrights.
  1. What are the characteristics of copyright ? Explain.
  1. Explain the scope of literacy work with illustrations.

Short Note

  1. Computer software and copyright. 2x
  1. Write a note on termination of licence of copyright.
  1. State the procedure for assignment of copyright.
  1. Cinematographic work.
  1. Copyright Societies.
  1. Performers rights.
  1. Copyright Board.
  1. Literary works.

Problem Questions

  1. A work of fiction is written by 'X', 'Y' reads the work and author work carrying 10 chapters of the previous book which have been paraphrased by him though marginally. Whether 'Y' has infringed the right's ol'X' ?
  1. 'A' had borrowed a part of speech which was only of two-and-half minutes duration in a three hour film. State whether A's act amounts to infringement.
  1. 'A'writes a book. Can he be compelled to obtain copyright over it ?
  1. 'Z' has developed a new computer software programme. He wants to obtain protection for it. Advise him.
  1. Three photographers took photo of statue of Mahatma Gandhi situated at a circle in a town. Now the photographers claim copyright over the photos. Can they claim ?
  1. Balaraj and company obtains copyright on pictorial representation of Lord Balasubrahmanya in a human form. Canaiah and Company challenges it before the coufi on the ground that it lacks originality. Decide.
  1. 'M', conducts a research study on the heaith conditions of rural children. During a debate on the programme for improvement of health conditions of rural children, M’s research report is circulated in Loksabha. The circulation is made without the permission of the author. Can M bring legal action against it ?
  1. A teacher who is a paper setter for the examination' picks up an extract from “Malgudidays"' a popular short stories collection authored by R.K. Narayan and asks questions based on the extract in the English question paper set by him. Can the legal heirs of "R' K' Narayan bring an action against tne paplr setter for infringement of copy right ? Decide'
  1. A work of fiction is written by ‘A’. B reads the book and authors a work carrying 10 chapters of the book written by A which he has paraphrased through marginally. Whether B has infringed the rights of A?
  1. Ashok a Ph.D. scholar referred a book "Science and LaW' written by Chandrashen and copied 50 pages from it. Now Chandrashen wants to take action against Ashok. Advice him.
  1. A, a Private Limited Company, is publishing a daily newspaper and B has agreed to write an article every week for Rs. 1,000 per article. Who is the first owner of this article between A and B?Decide.
  1. A is a music composer, B is a singer, C is a writer and D is a producer of a film. D asks A, B and C to prepare 6 songs to be recorded in his film and pays the remuneration as per their demand to all of them. Who is the owner of these six songs ? Decide.
  1. A drama was playing'in an auditorium. Some of the selected audience were invited by open ticket. lt included directors and producers who came there to watch the play as the final product of their efforts. ls copyright subsists in drama ?

UNIT II - Biological Diversity Law

Essay Type

  1. Explain the constitution, powers and functions of Bio-diversity authority. 6x
  1. Explain the meaning, scope and features of Biological Diversity Act, 2002. 3x
  1. State the important f eatures of Convention of Biological Diversity (CBD) 1961. 2x
  1. Discuss the rights and duties of contracting parties in making use of genetic resources under the convention of bio-diversity.
  1. What are the duties of the Central and State Governments in the conservation of Biological Diversity ?
  1. who is a benefit claimer ? How can benefit-sharing be given effect to under Bio-diversity Act, 2002 ?
  1. Explain the objectives of convention on Bio-diversity (CBD).

Short Note

  1. National Gene Fund. 3x
  1. State Bio-diversity Board. 2x
  1. Bio piracy. 2x
  1. Enumerate the issues of biological diversity.
  1. Biodiversity managing committee.
  1. National Biodiversity Authority.
  1. Convention on bio-diversity.
  1. Benefit sharing

UNIT III - Plant Varieties & Farmers Rights Law

Essay Type

  1. Explain the procedure for registration of plant varieties underthe Protection of Plant Varieties and Farmer's Hight Act, 2001. 2x
  1. what are the powers and functions of protection,of plant Varieties and Farmers' Rights Authority ? 2x
  1. Define the term ' farmer '. Explain objects of the Protection of Plant Varieties and Farmers' Rights Act, 2001.
  1. What are the protection available for Plant Varieties and Farmers Rights? Explain.
  1. Explain the remedies against infringement of Plant Varieties and Farmer's Rights.
  1. Discuss plant breeder's, researcher's and community rights . State the exceptions.
  1. lndia has adopted sui generis system for protection of plant and plant varieties. Elucidate.

Short Note

  1. Explain the procedure for registration of Plant Varieties.
  1. Write a note on compulsory licence of plant varieties.
  1. Farmers’ rights.

Problem Questions

  1. An agent of the registered plant variety wants to institute legal proceeding for infringement in his own name as if he were the breeder. Will he succeed ? 2x
  1. The Registrar appointed under Protection of Plant Varieties and Farmers' Rights Act refuses an application forcorrection of the register being submitted by the registered breeder of the plant
    variety in oral form. Can such refusal be challenged ?
  1. A person obtains compulsory licence regarding a registered plant variety, but the breeder fails to provide necessary seeds to the person who obtained the compulsory licence. Decide. Give reasons.

UNIT IV - Designs Law

Essay Type

  1. What is an Industrial design? Explain the conditions and procedure for registration of designs. 2x
  1. Explain the salient features of the Designs Act, 1911. 2x
  1. Define the term 'design'. what are the prohibitions imposable on registration of design ?
  1. What remedies are available against the piracy of copyright design ?
  1. Narrate the powers and duties of the controller of designs.
  1. Explain ' Design ' and ' Functional Design ' with their essentials.
  1. Briefly discuss the difference between Design and Trade Mark.
  1. What are the essential characteristics of an industrial design ?

Short Note

  1. What are the legal remedies available for infringement of a registered design ?
  1. What is the procedure of registration of a design ?
  1. Cancellation of design.
  1. Significance of design.

Problem Questions

  1. One company manufactured globes mounted on wooden frame, the other manufactures globes mounted on gold frames, the structures of the mount remaining the same. The second company claims a copyright in the design asserting the novelty and originality of the gold frame. Can the company get a copyright in such a design ?
  1. 'X'has registered a design under the design Act, 2000. Can he also avail protection under the Copyright Act ? Advice him.
  1. A company in USA designs a shoe and wants to register the design in lndia. But similar designed shoe has already been sold in lndia. Advise the company.
  1. An architect creates a design for multi-stored building. A contractor, who constructed the building, claims copyright on the design. Can he claim ?
  1. ln a designing firm, P creates a design and Q fills the design with colour. P and Q claim copyright individually over it. Will they succeed.?
  1. The plaintiff and the defendant are engaged in selling of coconut oil using plastic bottle. The plaintiff seeks injunction before the coutt against the defendant for using of similar cap with movable lid and a hinge on the bottle as that of plaintiff's bottle. Against it, the defendant contends that the cap alone does not stand as an article for sale nor can it be described as a part of an article. Decide.
  1. A Carpenter designs wooden furniture for sale at commercial sale, later files an infringement suit against a neighbouring carpenter who sells similar furniture pleading copyright violations. can his work be called a artistic work and will his claims is succeed.

UNIT V - International Treaties, Conventions & TRIPS

Essay Type

  1. Explain the salient features of Paris Convention . 3x
  1. Explain the objectives of TRIPS agreement. 2x
  1. Explain the object of ' Berne Convention '. 2x
  1. Enumerate the objectives of convention on Bio-diversity .
  1. Examine the salient features of TRIPS Agreement.

Short Note

  1. What are the protections available to geographical indicators under TRIPS ?
  1. DOHA Convention.
  1. Berne Convention.
  1. Paris Convention.
  1. TRIPS.
  1. WIPO
